apiumGraveolens: Apium graveolens, commonly known as celery, is a biennial herb known for its crisp stalks and distinctive flavor. As a tisane, it is often used for its potential diuretic properties and to support digestion.
achyranthesBidentata: Achyranthes bidentata, commonly known as "buffalo horn," is a perennial herb traditionally used in herbal medicine, particularly in Asian cultures. It is often consumed as a tisane to support joint health and improve circulation.
acorusCalamus: Acorus calamus, commonly known as sweet flag, is a perennial wetland plant with aromatic rhizomes. Traditionally, it has been used in herbal medicine to enhance digestion and alleviate anxiety.
cimicifugaRacemosa: Cimicifuga racemosa, commonly known as black cohosh, is a flowering plant native to North America, often used to alleviate menopausal symptoms and regulate menstrual cycles. Its root is typically prepared as a tisane to harness its potential benefits for women's health.
ageratumConyzoides: Ageratum conyzoides, commonly known as billygoat weed, is a flowering plant often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. It is typically prepared as a tisane to help alleviate symptoms such as headaches and digestive issues.
leonurusCardiaca: Leonurus cardiaca, commonly known as motherwort, is a flowering plant in the mint family, traditionally used to relieve menstrual discomfort and anxiety. Its calming properties make it a favorable choice for herbal teas targeting stress and women's health.
agrimoniaEupatoria: Agrimonia eupatoria, commonly known as agrimony, is a perennial herb with distinctive yellow flowers and serrated leaves. It is traditionally used for its astringent properties and may aid in digestive health and support skin conditions when consumed as a tisane.
alliumSativum: Allium sativum, commonly known as garlic, is a bulbous plant renowned for its strong flavor and numerous health benefits, including antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties. Its leaves and bulbs can be infused into a tisane for digestive support and overall wellness.
trachyspermumAmmi: Trachyspermum ammi, commonly known as ajwain or carom seeds, is an aromatic herb widely used in traditional medicine and cooking. Its tisane is believed to aid digestion and relieve respiratory issues.
alchemillaXanthochlora: Alchemilla xanthochlora, commonly known as yellow lady's mantle, is a perennial herb renowned for its scalloped leaves and clusters of greenish-yellow flowers. Traditionally used in herbal medicine, it is valued for its potential benefits in women's health and its mild astringent properties.
sisymbriumAlliaria: Sisymbrium alliaria, commonly known as garlic mustard, is a biennial herb with heart-shaped leaves and small white flowers. Traditionally used for its potential digestive benefits and as a natural remedy for respiratory issues, its leaves can be infused to create a soothing tisane.
amomumCardamomum: Amomum cardamomum, commonly known as black cardamom, is a spice with a distinctive smoky flavor, often used in savory dishes and teas. It is known for its potential digestive benefits and ability to enhance respiratory health.
anemarrhenaAsphodeloides: Anemarrhena asphodeloides, also known as the "Zhimu," is a perennial herb native to East Asia, traditionally used in herbal medicine for its cooling properties and to support respiratory and digestive health. It can be prepared as a tisane to help alleviate symptoms of heat-related conditions.
anethumGraveolens: Anethum graveolens, commonly known as dill, is an aromatic herb with feathery green leaves and yellow flowers. It is often used as a tisane for its soothing properties and digestive benefits.
angelicaSinensis: Angelica sinensis, also known as Dong Quai, is a traditional Chinese herb often used to support women's health, particularly in balancing hormones and alleviating menstrual discomfort. Its roots are typically brewed into a soothing tisane that may promote circulation and overall vitality.
pimpinellaAnisum: Pimpinella anisum, commonly known as anise, features aromatic seeds that impart a sweet, licorice-like flavor. It is often used in herbal teas to aid digestion and relieve coughs.
arbutusUnedo: Arbutus unedo, commonly known as the strawberry tree, is an evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Mediterranean region. Its leaves and fruits are used to brew tisanes that are traditionally believed to aid in digestion and provide antioxidant benefits.
artemisiaVulgaris: Artemisia vulgaris, commonly known as mugwort, is a fragrant perennial herb traditionally used to aid digestion, relieve anxiety, and enhance dreams. Its leaves can be brewed into a pungent tisane that is both soothing and aromatic.
cynaraScolymus: Cynara scolymus, commonly known as artichoke, is a perennial thistle with edible buds and leaves that are often used to make a digestive tisane. This herb is known for its potential benefits in supporting liver health and improving digestion.

astragalusMongholicus: Astragalus mongholicus, commonly known as Mongolian milkvetch, is a perennial herb celebrated for its immune-boosting properties and is often used in traditional medicine to enhance vitality and longevity. The root of the plant is commonly prepared as a tisane to support overall health and promote energy.

bidensPilosa: Bidens pilosa, commonly known as Spanish needles or beggar's-ticks, is a flowering plant often used in traditional herbal medicine. Its leaves and flowers can be brewed into a tisane, which is believed to support immune health and provide anti-inflammatory benefits.
persicariaBistorta: Persicaria bistorta, also known as bistort or snakeweed, is a perennial herb with broad, lanceolate leaves and tall spikes of pinkish flowers. Traditionally, it has been used in herbal medicine to support digestive health and alleviate gastrointestinal issues.

ononisSpinosa: Ononis spinosa, commonly known as spiny restharrow, is a perennial herb traditionally used for its diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties. Its roots and aerial parts are often prepared as a tisane to support urinary health and alleviate bodily discomfort.

callunaVulgaris: Calluna vulgaris, commonly known as heather, is a low-growing evergreen shrub with small purple flowers. Traditionally used in herbal medicine, it is believed to have diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties and is often infused as a tisane for its soothing effects.
tanacetumParthenium: Tanacetum parthenium, commonly known as feverfew, is a flowering plant valued for its anti-inflammatory properties and is traditionally used to alleviate headaches and migraine symptoms. Its leaves can be brewed into a tisane to promote overall wellness.

carthamusTinctorius: Carthamus tinctorius, commonly known as safflower, is a flowering plant whose petals are used to make a soothing tisane. Traditionally, it is believed to support circulation and promote wellness, often used in herbal remedies for its mild flavor and vibrant color.

silybumMarianum: Silybum marianum, commonly known as milk thistle, is a flowering plant recognized for its striking purple flowers and distinctive marbled leaves. chelidoniumMajus: Chelidonium majus, commonly known as greater celandine, is a perennial herb featuring yellow flowers and a distinct orange latex sap. chenopodiumAmbrosioides: Chenopodium ambrosioides, commonly known as epazote, is a perennial herb with distinctive jagged leaves and a strong, pungent aroma. Traditionally used in herbal medicine, it is often brewed into a tisane to alleviate digestive issues and reduce gas.

cochleariaOfficinalis: Cochlearia officinalis, commonly known as scurvy grass, is a coastal plant rich in vitamin C and has historically been used to prevent scurvy. Its peppery leaves can be brewed into a refreshing tisane that may support overall vitality.

papaverRhoeas: Papaver rhoeas, commonly known as corn poppy or field poppy, is a vibrant red flower whose petals are often used to make a soothing tisane that may promote relaxation and help with sleep. Traditionally, its infusion has been used for its mild sedative properties.
coriandrumSativum: Coriandrum sativum, commonly known as coriander or cilantro, is an annual herb with fresh, fragrant leaves and small, round seeds. Used in various cuisines, its leaves can be brewed into a refreshing tisane that may support digestion and overall well-being.

lactucaVirosa: Lactuca virosa, commonly known as wild lettuce, is a biennial plant with a milky latex that has been traditionally used for its sedative and pain-relieving properties. Its leaves can be made into a tisane to help promote relaxation and alleviate mild anxiety.
lamiumAlbum: Lamium album, commonly known as white dead-nettle, is a perennial herb with white flowers and soft, hairy leaves. It is traditionally used in herbal medicine for its soothing properties, particularly in teas to relieve respiratory issues and promote relaxation.
coixLacrymaJob: Coix lacryma-jobi, commonly known as Job's tears, is a perennial grass that produces tear-shaped seeds often used in traditional herbal medicine. The seeds are believed to have diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties and are commonly made into a soothing tisane.
laurusNobilis: Laurus nobilis, commonly known as bay laurel, is an aromatic evergreen tree whose leaves are used in cooking and traditional medicine. The leaves are often brewed into a tisane for their potential health benefits, including digestive support and anti-inflammatory properties.
cymbopogonCitratus: Cymbopogon citratus, commonly known as lemongrass, is a tropical plant with a strong lemon fragrance. It is often used in herbal teas for its refreshing flavor and potential digestive benefits.
leonurusJaponicus: Leonurus japonicus, also known as Japanese motherwort, is a flowering plant traditionally used in herbal medicine for its calming and menstrual-regulating properties. Its leaves and flowers can be brewed into a tisane to support relaxation and reproductive health.
cetrariaIslandica: Cetraria islandica, commonly known as Iceland moss, is a lichen that grows in cold, northern regions. Traditionally used as a soothing remedy for respiratory ailments and digestive issues, it is often prepared as a tisane for its mild flavor and health benefits.
hederaHelix: Hedera helix, commonly known as English ivy, is an evergreen vine that is often used for its potential respiratory benefits and as a natural remedy for coughs. Its leaves can be brewed into a tisane to help soothe respiratory issues and promote overall health.
glechomaHederacea: Glechoma hederacea, commonly known as ground ivy or creeping Charlie, is a perennial herb with heart-shaped leaves and small purple flowers. linumUsitatissimum: Linum usitatissimum, commonly known as flaxseed or flax, is a plant prized for its small, nutritious seeds that are rich in omega-3 fatty acids and fiber. Its tisane is often consumed for digestive health and as a natural remedy for inflammation.
ligusticumSinense: Ligusticum sinense, commonly known as Chinese lovage, is an aromatic perennial herb often used in traditional Chinese medicine. It is valued for its potential anti-inflammatory and digestive benefits, typically enjoyed as a tisane to support overall wellness.
levisticumOfficinale: Levisticum officinale, commonly known as lovage, is a perennial herb characterized by its tall stems and rich green leaves. Traditionally, it is used for its digestive benefits and to enhance the flavor of soups and stews, but can also be enjoyed as a flavorful tisane.
lyciumBarbarum: Lycium barbarum, commonly known as goji berry, is a small red fruit from a shrub native to Asia. It is often brewed as a tisane for its potential health benefits, including antioxidant properties and support for immune function.
magnoliaOfficinalis: Magnolia officinalis, known as Hou Po, is a traditional medicinal herb valued for its calming properties and ability to support digestive health. The bark is commonly brewed into a tisane to promote relaxation and alleviate symptoms of anxiety.

aesculusHippocastanum: Aesculus hippocastanum, commonly known as horse chestnut, is a large deciduous tree known for its distinctive palmate leaves and spiky seed capsules. The seeds are often used in herbal remedies to support vein health and reduce inflammation.
marrubiumVulgare: Marrubium vulgare, commonly known as horehound, is a hardy perennial herb with a bitter taste traditionally used for its expectorant properties to help relieve coughs and respiratory issues. Its leaves can be steeped to make a soothing tisane.
ilexParaguariensis: Ilex paraguariensis, commonly known as yerba mate, is a South American plant whose leaves are traditionally used to make a stimulating herbal tea. Rich in caffeine and antioxidants, it is often enjoyed for its invigorating effects and social significance in many cultures.
matricariaRecutita: Matricaria chamomilla, commonly known as chamomile, is a daisy-like flowering plant renowned for its calming properties. Often brewed as a tisane, it is traditionally used to aid sleep, reduce anxiety, and alleviate digestive issues.
malvaSylvestris: Malva sylvestris, commonly known as common mallow, is a flowering plant in the mallow family. Its leaves and flowers are often used to make a soothing tisane that may help alleviate respiratory ailments and promote digestive health.
melilotusOfficinalis: Melilotus officinalis, commonly known as sweet clover, is a tall, herbaceous plant with sweet-smelling yellow flowers. Traditionally used as a tisane, it is believed to support circulation and may have mild sedative effects.
melissaOfficinalis: Melissa officinalis, commonly known as lemon balm, is a fragrant herb belonging to the mint family. It is often used in tisanes for its calming effects, helping to alleviate stress and promote relaxation.
menthaXPiperita: Mentha × piperita, commonly known as peppermint, is a hybrid mint renowned for its refreshing flavor and aroma. It is often used in tisanes for its soothing properties, aiding digestion and providing relief from headaches.

achilleaMillefolium: Achillea millefolium, commonly known as yarrow, is a flowering plant with delicate white to pink flowers and feathery leaves. solanumNigrum: Solanum nigrum, commonly known as black nightshade, is a herbaceous plant with small green berries and white or purple flowers. origanumVulgare: Origanum vulgare, commonly known as oregano, is a perennial herb renowned for its aromatic leaves, which are often used in cooking. peperomiaPellucida: Peperomia pellucida, commonly known as shining pepperleaf, is a small, succulent herb recognized for its fleshy, heart-shaped leaves. It is traditionally used in herbal medicine for its anti-inflammatory and diuretic properties, often consumed as a tisane for digestive support.

plantagoMajor: Plantago major, commonly known as broadleaf plantain, is a perennial herb with broad leaves and small flower spikes. It is often used in tisane for its soothing properties to support respiratory health and reduce inflammation.

anacyclusPyrethrum: Anacyclus pyrethrum, commonly known as pellitory of the wall, is a flowering plant known for its root, which has a history of use as a traditional remedy to alleviate headaches and dental pain. cinchonaPubescens: Cinchona pubescens, commonly known as quina or cinchona bark, is a tree native to South America known for its bark, which contains quinine, a compound traditionally used to treat malaria. Its tisane is also believed to have tonic properties and can aid in digestion.
krameriaTriandra: Krameria triandra, commonly known as rhatany, is a plant native to South America, recognized for its strong astringent properties. Traditionally used in herbal medicine, its root is often prepared as a tisane to help alleviate digestive issues and promote oral health.
glycyrrhizaGlabra: Glycyrrhiza glabra, commonly known as licorice root, is a sweet-tasting herb used traditionally to soothe sore throats, ease digestive issues, and reduce inflammation. Its tisane is enjoyed for its natural sweetness and potential health benefits.
rehmanniaGlutinosa: Rehmannia glutinosa, commonly known as Chinese rehmannia or prepared rehmannia, is a perennial herb traditionally used in Chinese medicine to tonify the kidney and nourish the blood. Its root is often brewed into a tisane to support overall vitality and combat fatigue.
filipendulaUlmaria: Filipendula ulmaria, commonly known as meadowsweet, is a perennial herb with fragrant white flowers and feathery leaves.
